meanings.definition: The students who attend a school but do not live on the premises.
meanings.sent1: Outpupils are students who go to school but don't live there.
meanings.sent2: The outpupils take the bus to school every day.
meanings.sent3: The outpupils have a special club for students who live far away.
meanings.sent4: Being outpupils, they bring diversity and new perspectives to the school.
meanings.sent5: The outpupils' presence enriches the school community.

meanings.definition: To exceed in number or quality.
meanings.sent1: The number of volunteers outpupils the number of staff.
meanings.sent2: Her kindness outpupils anyone else's in the office.
meanings.sent3: The cake outpupils all the other desserts at the party.
meanings.sent4: His dedication outpupils that of his peers.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the sunset outpupils any painting I've seen.
